item.title: Collaboration Systems
item.dc:creator: jranderson2
item.content:encoded:
What are Collaboration Systems?

Collaboration Systems are very simply stated are tools and applications which enable the collaborative work efforts of individuals within an organization. An organization may take a formal form such a company or even a subset of employees who form a work group, or it make be less formal such as a group of programmers who volunteer their time to work on an opensource project. The basis of any team or organization is a group of people working together towards a common goal. By navigating through the links at the top of the page you can explore the different types of collaboration software. The benefits realized through the utilization of collaboration software is also discussed along with testimonials from individuals working in various industries who leverage collaboration software on a daily basis.

item.title: Group Management
item.dc:creator: jranderson2
item.content:encoded:
What is Group Management software?

Group Management software is all about the control of the people in a collaboration project. Keeping track of the project, people, and knowledge comes with great burden if not handled well. Three major types of software encapsulate Group Management:
  • calendars
  • project management & workflow software
  • knowledge management systems
Let's take a look at these 3 types

Calendars

Online-enabled Calendars offer tremendous coordination of a team. Sharing calendars allows efficient access for team members to coordinate meetings as creating meetings no longer requires phoning every team member and working out a schedule. [caption id="attachment_35" align="aligncenter" width="984"] Example Calendar Software[/caption]

Project Management & Workflow Software

The latest method to developing software uses the Agile method. Agile is all about getting working code to the customer (i.e., the users) and keeping the code alive and ever-evolving by delivering finished code in smaller pieces of time, called Sprints. Stories (or tickets) are grouped into Epics (or categories). Project Management & Workflow software assists teams in managing the Stories throughout the different Epics as new code is delivered in the sequential Sprints. The most popular software for Agile development comes from the team at Atlassian named JIRA. The power of this software comes in the form of:
  1. Planning
  2. Tracking
  3. Releasing
  4. Reporting
[caption id="attachment_46" align="aligncenter" width="984"] JIRA Dashboard[/caption] [caption id="attachment_49" align="aligncenter" width="984"] JIRA Backlog (Planning)[/caption]

Knowledge Management Systems

Wikipedia encapsulates the global Knowledge Management system. Everyone can be an editor for knowledge that makes up the online encyclopedia. This power scales down to Agile teams in the form of internal Knowledge Management systems. Many solutions exist for internal Knowledge Management. Two popular systems are:
  • MediaWiki
  • Confluence
MediaWiki provides a familiar face as it is the open-source software that powers Wikipedia, and, as open source software, provides internal teams an easy way to create and manage Knowledge. Confluence, a paid-solution, comes from the same team that made JIRA and offers many useful features and the ability to integrate into JIRA. [caption id="attachment_56" align="aligncenter" width="812"] Confluence[/caption] [caption id="attachment_57" align="aligncenter" width="984"] MediaWiki[/caption]

item.title: Communication Support
item.dc:creator: jranderson2
item.content:encoded:
What is Support of Group Communication software?

Group communication software comes in a variety of flavors. Something as simple as a chat session that a group belongs or subscribes to - to the more complex video chat communication software. Chat software - software in which you just want to engage with clients or others in a simple conversation. Most chat software has analytics and logging so conversations can be on the record or off the record.
  • Google Chat - This software which is part of the Google products. You can send and receive instant messages with anyone using Google Chat, Google Hangouts or other third party chat applications. http://www.google.com
  • LiveChat - can be rolled into a web implementation and has in interface that appears when a visitor is on your website and you can engage them in a conversation. https://www.livechatinc.com
  • PureChat - another chat software package that is rolled into your website to allow for you to engage in conversations with your potential customers and website visitors. http://www.purechat.com
Video Conferencing Software - video conferencing is one step above simply chatting with your clients or customers. You can engage in a video meeting which allows you much of what you have in a face to face meeting. You have to ability to gauge your audience and have your audience interact with you through the video conference.
  • GoToMeeting - This software / site allows you to meet via video face to face, share your screen, it is mobile friendly, has seamless audio, you can set up personal meeting rooms and record your conference. It is as simple as 1 ... 2 ... 3. http://www.gotomeeting.com
    • Choose your device / start your meeting
    • Send invitations
    • Start working together
  • Join Me - Easy to use, easy to join and easy to manage. It is a simple and instant online meeting solution. There is no download for viewers. https://www.join.me
  • Cisco WebEx - A part of the Cisco family of products WebEx provides tools to start a meeting and share your screen. http://www.webex.com

item.title: Group Work
item.dc:creator: jranderson2
item.content:encoded:
What is software for Group Work?

Software for Group Work is about supporting specific work activities of the group. Software for Group Work generally takes one of two forms:
  • shared documents
  • version control software
Let's take a look at these 2 types.

Shared Documents

Shared documents offer the ability for individuals in a team to edit the same document. The document is hosted in one location so every team member is seeing and editing the same document, rather than sharing a number of copies which may not always match up. Some of the most popular applications for sharing documents include Google Drive, Microsoft Office Online, and Wikis. [caption id="attachment_87" align="alignnone" width="1920"] Google Drive Page[/caption]

Version Control Software

Version Control Software manages changes made to documents and files, including, but not limited to software code. Version Control Systems may take the form of emedded software within programs such as word processors, but they are often stand alone applications as well. Some of the popular version control systems used in software development include Concurrent Versions System (CVS), Subversion, and Git. These systems are often supported by plugins within Integrated Development Environments such as Eclipse and IntelliJ. They may also be ran from a command line terminal as well. Using Git as an example, let's look at some of the features and processes provided by version control software. Git is a wildly popular tool in developer communities. GitHub is a web repository hosting service in which many open source projects are shared providing simple access to the code and the ability to easily contribute to a multitude of projects. [caption id="attachment_89" align="alignnone" width="1920"] GitHub Repository[/caption] As a user, a Git repository may be cloned and checked out. This would mean that using a few simple commands a user can download a copy of the code from the repository to their local machine. From here they may use the software they downloaded or they may actually make changes to this code, such as improvements, fixes, or additions, and submit it back to be included in the repository. Developing new code which is used in a project makes you a contributor. If they choose to make changes they may submit them back using a Push command, often to a new branch. Using branches to push or change code keeps potential changes out of the master version. By doing this another contributor may review the code changes and test them prior to merging them into the master code. This may be especially helpful if the master branch is being updated as numbered builds. As multiple contributors make changes they may continuously submit branches with their new code. The result of merging a number of changes together into the master code all at once may actually be the release of a new version which has gone through checks, testing, and verification to ensure it works with minimal known bugs and the features intended. GitHub also provides wikis for documentation of projects, issue tracking, and change tracking as additional tools for the collaborative process. Every GitHub repository works with Subversion as well as Git.

item.title: Benefits
item.dc:creator: jranderson2
item.content:encoded:
What are the benefits to collaboration software?

Testimonials

"Collaborative software has been extremely useful in work coordination and resource management. It is especially beneficial when working in a collaborative team. These softwares greatly improve work efficiency and help with avoiding conflicts and duplicate work. It also facilitates the convenience of working remotely when the other team members are in different cities." - FW - Data Scientist, Large technology company "IBM is a global company, where skills are not necessarily available in one location, or even co-located with the customer.  Collaboration tools provide the single source of truth for everyone in a geographically distributed team, including the customer." - KM - International Business Machines "I work remotely as a member of a fast-paced WW sales organization, interacting with colleagues around the world. We get our jobs done with collaborative software every minute of every day in many ways. Sellers, subject matter experts and executives at all levels are available instantly via instant messaging. In a sales environment, this is critical for quick response and issue resolution. Sales tools, processes, presentations and collateral are shared in a common wiki and file repository community, organized for easy access to these reference materials. We use online meetings for education and information sharing, which saves travel and speeds communication of critical information. With streaming replays, the content is always available for reference and for anyone who couldn't attend the live session. In this virtual world, our collaborative software solutions allow us to work as a cohesive, high performance team." -CE - Program Manager, Worldwide Sales, Large technology company "I don't know how groups of people efficiently collaborated before the Internet-enabled technologies that we have today. I suppose that the fast-paced and constantly improving nature of the world have guided businesses in this direction, but the tools available to us now guarantee my employees are able to perform their job no matter where they are -- which also keeps them more satisfied. One of my Business Analysts can be in one of our Global offices in the U.K. while still collaborating with my other Business Analysts back in the states, and this gives my team an almost unlimited amount of flexibility to provide our customers -- internal clients -- the best software that they deserve" -MT- Systems Manager, Customer Care, Large technology company

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: jranderson2
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.
